DOC.HEAD: Man Kills Wife, Stepdaughter Before Taking His Own Life
DOC.TEXT: An 83-year-old man who often argued heatedly with his stepdaughter shot her and his wife dead on Christmas Day, then killed himself, police said Tuesday. Donnie Carlisle shot his wife, Virginia, 80, in the head, and his stepdaughter, Carolyn Dempsey, 53, in the head and chest about 7 p.m. Monday, Lt. Michael A. Butler said. He then left the house and went to the nearby home of his daughter, Butler said. ``I just shot Virginia, I just shot Carolyn, and now I'm going to shoot myself,'' Mary Davis said her father told her. Ms. Davis said she tried to stop her father, but he knocked her down, went back to his house and shot himself in the head and chest, Butler said. Carlisle died about two hours later at Self Memorial Hospital, he said. Officers found a .22-caliber rifle in the Carlisles' living room that apparently was used in the shootings. Ms. Davis told investigators her father threatened to kill the women and himself on Saturday after arguing with Ms. Dempsey. Ms. Davis said she talked her father out of it. ``He stayed at her house about half the day just talking about how he was being treated,'' the police report said. Ms. Davis told investigators ``there were always very heated arguments'' between her father and Ms. Dempsey. Police did not say what those arguments were about.
